page.title: 19THOMAS OWEN;SOUTHSEA.
page.content: The distinctive area of Southsea round{St.Jude's Church}was developed from 1837 to 1862 by an original local architect, developer and town planner,{Thomas Ellis Owen}(1804-1862) He created a fashionable garden suburb in the developing resort of Southsea, close to the old fortified town of Portsmouth. He laid out Italianate villas and grand Regency terraces in winding high walled lanes planted with fine trees. His grandest composition,{Portland {Terrace,}to the west of Southsea shopping precinct, has been restored as flats by Portsmouth Housing Association. { St.Jude's Church}(1851) in Kent Road, with its soaring spire, acts as a sea- mark for incoming ships to Portsmouth Harbour.It forms the centrepiece of the outstanding Conservation Area.
